intro: Urachne songarica, commonly known as the Songaric urachne, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
